title: Transparency and provision of information to deployers

article_refs.quote: High-risk AI systems shall be designed and developed in such a way as to ensure that their operation is sufficiently transparent to enable deployers to interpret a system’s output and use it appropriately.

legal_consequence.verbatim: High-risk AI systems shall be designed and developed in such a way as to ensure that their operation is sufficiently transparent to enable deployers to interpret a system’s output and use it appropriately.

items.label: Instructions for use
items.text: Systems shall be accompanied by instructions for use containing at least the specified identity, intended purpose, performance (accuracy/robustness/cybersecurity), risks, explanation capabilities, performance on specific groups where applicable, data set specifications where appropriate, and information to interpret outputs.

items.label: Penalty and enforcement (Article 99)
items.text: Obligation/requirement. Administrative fines up to EUR 15,000,000 or 3% of worldwide turnover (whichever is higher) may apply for non‑compliance (subject to SME caps and due process).

question.prompt: Does Article 2 scope apply (and no exclusion)?
